bio.title: About the Author
bio.p: Aysha Akhtar, MD, MPH is a Fellow of the Oxford Centre for Animal Ethics and a neurologist and public health specialist with the Food and Drug Administration. She is the author of the book: Animals and Public Health: Why treating animals better is critical to human welfare. The opinions expressed here are those of the author and do not represent the official position of the U.S. Food and Drug Administration or the U.S. government.
